snippet: The post office, which has missed two deadlines on future retiree health benefits, said it expected net operating losses to be $15 billion for the fiscal year that ended Sept. 30.
abstract: United States Postal Service defaults on a $5.6 billion payment due at the end of September, the second time it has missed a deadline to set aside money for its future retiree health benefits; says it expects net operating losses to be $15 billion for the fiscal year that just ended; officials hope that holiday mail and election mailings will offset some of the losses.
lead_paragraph: The post office, which has missed two deadlines on future retiree health benefits, said it expected net operating losses to be $15 billion for the fiscal year that ended Sept. 30.

headline.seo: Postal Service Defaults on a $5.6 Billion Benefits Payment
headline.main: Distress Deepening, Postal Service Defaults on $5.6 Billion Benefits Payment
headline.print_headline: Distress Deepening, Postal Service Defaults on $5.6 Billion Benefits Payment
